channel.title: How can I change some icons?
channel.description:
I recently discovered this sweet icon pack ([url='https://feliustanaka.deviantart.com/gallery/7878573#/d21etg2']here[/url]) and it's full of .ico files. Normally I hit 'Properties' and change the used icon that way, but folder icons don't seem to work that way.
Any ideas?

item.title: How can I change some icons?
item.dc:creator: Ry_amp_955_n
item.description:
Yeah, it brings me to an “open with” window with a “programs to use” list that are all found in my computer. It bscly smiles at me in a troll-like fashion every time i attempt to run a specific program on my machine. one of my registry files must have been overwritten or fucked up. i just can’t fix it.

And isn’t a windows xp cd required to successfully run that repair scan?

Read full topic
item.source: How can I change some icons?

item.title: How can I change some icons?
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
I’m assuming that’s rundll32.exe, not rundlel32.exe.

Try this:
Open a command prompt window and type this:
sfc /scannow

This may fix your rundll32.exe problem. Let me know how it works.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I change some icons?

item.title: How can I change some icons?
item.dc:creator: Ry_amp_955_n
item.description:
Quick question that sort of relates:
I right click on my desktop, click properties, and get this:

C:\WINDOWS\system32\rundlel32.exe
Application not found

why can’t it perform that simple task?
and what would the remedy be?

Read full topic

item.title: How can I change some icons?
item.dc:creator: doomyshadowsquirrels
item.description:
@danielsangeo
I’m running Windows 7. Tired that, but many Properties menus don’t have a Customize tab, or a Change Icon for that matter

@PJAMA
meh… I’d prefer the knowledge to do the task myself for future reference…

Read full topic
item.source: How can I change some icons?

item.title: How can I change some icons?
item.dc:creator: PJAMA
item.description:
If It’s all the System Icons like folders and My Computer you want to replace, you should download IconPackager:
https://www.stardock.com/products/iconpackager/

It’s a free trial, but It’s usable for up to 60 days.

Or you could try to edit the registry.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I change some icons?

item.title: How can I change some icons?
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Assuming you’re in Windows 7, right click the folder, choose Properties, then switch over to “Customize”. You should find something called “Folder icons”. Change 'em from there.

Might be like that for Vista as well.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I change some icons?
